head.title: 4/03/20 COVID-19 Related School Update - South Putnam Community School Corporation

meta.content: Governor Eric Holcomb announced Indiana schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. SPCSC will be using some Home Learning Days in April and May to continue learning for our students. That schedule is reflected in our Spring 2020 Learning Plan Calendar. Grab-and-go breakfasts and lunches will be available for weekly pick up for students through the end of the learning calendar. Click on this article for more details and links to information.

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

nav.div: South Putnam Community School Corporation » News » What's New » 4/03/20 COVID-19 Related School Update

div.img:
Governor Eric Holcomb announced Indiana schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. SPCSC will be using some Home Learning Days in April and May to continue learning for our students. That schedule is reflected in our Spring 2020 Learning Plan Calendar. Grab-and-go breakfasts and lunches will be available for weekly pick up for students through the end of the learning calendar. Families wanting meals should complete the SP Food Request Form linked below.
Spring 2020 Learning Plan Calendar
2020 Food Request Form
MS/HS Additional Learning Resources (optional)
South Putnam Community School Corporation Continuous Learning Plan

div.p: South Putnam Community School Corporation does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district's activities and programs. South Putnam Community School Corporation also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
